docs.title: Welcome to Interview Tracker
docs.text: Interview Tracker is a modern, cross-platform desktop application designed to help you organize and track your job search process.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Pipeline Management: Track applications across different stages (Applied, Interviewing, Offer, etc.).
  • Interview Scheduling: Manage upcoming interviews with integrated calendar views.
  • Question Bank: Store and organize interview questions and answers.
  • Offline First: Works completely offline. Your data is safe on your device.
  • Google Integration: (Optional) Sync your data with Google Sheets and Google Calendar.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Check the Installation guide to get set up, or jump straight to the User Guide to learn how to use the application.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Interview Tracker is available for Windows, Linux, and macOS.

docs.title: Download
docs.text:
Go to the Releases page and download the latest version for your operating system.

  • Windows: Download interview-tracker-windows.zip.
  • Linux: Download interview-tracker-linux.tar.gz.
  • macOS: Download interview-tracker-macos.zip.

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
1. Extract the downloaded zip file.
  2. Run Interview Tracker.exe.
  3. The application will start immediately.

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
1. Extract the tarball: tar -xzf interview-tracker-linux.tar.gz.
  2. Run the executable: ./Interview Tracker/Interview Tracker.

docs.title: Google Integration (Optional)
docs.text:
To enable syncing with Google Sheets and Calendar, you need a credentials.json file.

  1. Obtain Credentials:
  2. Go to the Google Cloud Console.
  3. Create a project and enable Google Sheets API and Google Calendar API.

  4. Create OAuth 2.0 Desktop App credentials and download the JSON file.

  5. Upload to App:

  6. Open Interview Tracker.
  7. Go to Settings.
  8. Click Upload credentials.json and select your downloaded file.
  9. Click Authenticate with Google.

docs.title: Dashboard
docs.text: The dashboard gives you a quick overview of your job search status. You can see: - Total active pipelines - Upcoming interviews - Recent activity

docs.title: Managing Pipelines
docs.text: A Pipeline represents a specific job application.

docs.title: Creating a Pipeline
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Pipelines tab.
  2. Click Add Pipeline.
  3. Enter the Company Name, Role, and current Status.

docs.title: Tracking Progress
docs.text: Click on any pipeline to view details, add notes, or change its status (e.g., from "Applied" to "Interviewing").

docs.title: Scheduling
docs.text:
1. Go to Interviews or open a specific Pipeline.
  2. Click Schedule Interview.
  3. Select the date, time, and type of interview (Technical, HR, etc.).

docs.title: Google Calendar Sync
docs.text: If you have set up Google Integration, your interviews can be automatically added to your Google Calendar. This can be toggled in Settings.

docs.title: Question Bank
docs.text:
Prepare for interviews by tracking common questions.

  1. Go to Questions.
  2. Add new questions you've encountered or want to practice.
  3. You can categorize them (e.g., Behavioral, Technical) and add your answers.

docs.title: Settings & Sync
docs.text:
Configure the application in the Settings tab.

  • Sync Status: Shows if you are online and if your data is being synced.
  • Sync Mode:
    • Local Only: Data stays on your machine.
    • Sync on Change: Updates are sent to Google Sheets immediately.
    • Sync Periodically: Updates are batched.
  • Data Management: View where your local database is stored.
